result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald J Lyons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 07/08/2022: Added attorney fees in amount of $390.00 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donald J Lyons

defendant.name: Lyons, Donald J
defendant.address: 401 N Constitution Dr Apt 203, Aurora, IL 60506

records.addlTxt: To defendant with final court appointed attorney bill and payment plan information.
Court Appointed Attorney fees in the amount of $390.00 for Attorney Braziel.
Added attorney fees in amount of $390.00 due to Eau Claire County Clerk of Courts.
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(11:31 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Donald J Lyons does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Brian A Braziel appeared by video for Donald J Lyons.
Victim/Witness statute complied with.  
Attorney Braziel advises there is an agreement and Attorney Braziel will be entering a plea on the defendant's behalf.
State moves to amend Count 1 to an ordinance violation of County Disorderly Conduct.
Court approves the State's motion and amends Count 1 to an ordinance violation of County Disorderly Conduct.
Attorney Braziel enters a No Contest plea on the defendant's behalf to Amended Count 1.
Court accepts the No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Amended Count 1.
Court orders the defendant to pay court costs.
Order Approving Request for Zoom Appearance for defendant and Attorney Braziel for 05/31/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Dated 05/24/2022, Letter from Attorney Brian Braziel to Court requesting Zoom appearance for 05/31/2022 Initial Appearance.

Prior: 514 E State Ave #B, St Charles, IL 60174
Order appointing counsel to Defendant. Resent to new address per USPS.
